basics.name: Elijah Insua
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: Elijah Insua is a JavaScript and hardware enthusiast who is a huge fan of DIY, personal manufacturing, and tactile computer interfaces. He is the creator of jsdom, which has proven to be quite popular by enabling manipulation and composition of browser content on the server. He is also the creator of npmsearch.com, which offers lightning fast searching of the npm registry with packages organized by a custom relevance rating algorithm. Elijah is also well known for in-depth visualizations to assist effective hardware implementations.

highlights: Took ownership of a 50k+ daily user desktop application
Drastically reduced the number of crashes in the desktop application
Handled support tickets and worked through countless data race issues
Implemented product features spanning the entire stack
Built tooling to help identify and eliminate crashes
Conducted Node.js trainings at enterprise companies like Paypal
Conducted architectural evaluations at places such as NASA and Harvard
Led the N|Ship team and N|Solid frontend team
Built the certification pipeline for NodeSource Certified Modules
Made use of the Zend Framework to develop RESTful services
Wrote/Maintained WADLs to define RESTful services
Wrote a complete frontend for 6+ disperate RESTful services completely in javascript
Utilized the Kindling codebase to create Thebetterproject.org
Integrated software authentication with Facebook Connect, OAuth, OpenId and a custom WebHook implementation
Assumed the responsibilities of an entire IT staff when our client laid them all off
Implemented a CI/CD system to reduce deployment disasters
Led team through a rewrite of the existing Java stack into python
Built a, fully tested, browser based ebook reader
Used Node.js (0.2.x) as a rewriting proxy to allow the team to incrementally replace parts of the Java stack
Made use of the Zend Framework to quickly create a flexible pdf generator for wisconson weatherization agencies
Updated existing applications to conform to standards and feature requirements
Used jQuery and Dojo to validate client side forms and execute JSON requests
Converted abstract requirement documentation into maintainable code and database schemas
Created an extremely flexible content management system which we used to build web based products for local businesses
Managed an agile team by turning client requests into user stories and driving development cylce
Took technical service calls and brought new clients on board
Worked closely with business to create an custom fit application to suite their business needs
Build various API integrations using protocols like SOAP, REST, and XML-RPC
Designed and implemented a shopping cart with a plugable constraint system
Converted existing project over to Seagull based framework
Optimized SQL Queries for a 200% performance gain
Converted Photoshop psd's into XHML and CSS
Provided design and development for 6 projects ranging from ecommerce websites to dynamic photo galleries
Developed feature requests and fixed bugs for Seagull based projects
Implemented article revisioning timeline graphing
Used Dojo for cross-browser compatibility and accessiblity
Used PHP4 and MySQL / Postgres
Tested flight management systems for Honeywell
Developed, documented, and tested features in a custom waypoint database and flight management systems
Bug tested software systems on hardware at Honeywellâ€™s facilities
